posts.description: Inner Conflict Caused Scoring Yeezy Boosts | Solecollector
posts.extended: My heart is racing and palms are sweaty. There isn’t vomit on my sweater, but my credit card is ready. I’m trying not to cause a scene at the office so I don’t have to justify spending $220.

posts.description: "Is Basic Social Justice Really a Matter of Personal Opinion?" | Mother Jones
posts.extended: Ben drove a car I coveted. A bright yellow Karmann Ghia. Slick, low, designed for Volkswagen in an Italian studio famous for its sports cars. The very quintessence of cool to my eight-year-old self.

posts.description: 'white girl' is the most explosive portrait of nyc youth since 'kids' | read | i-D
posts.extended: Elizabeth Wood was 13 when she saw Kids. "My parents wanted me to watch it," Wood explains of Larry Clark's explosive profile of 90s youth at its most raw. "They were like, 'We need you to see this film, it's very important. It's what can happen when kids make mistakes. It's a cautionary tale.
